summary: Plan to clone the Wrokindia.in website/app (initially also requested renaming branding from Workindia to Instant Jobs).
known_issues: User reports that some functions are missing after deployment; needs investigation and restoration of expected functionality.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication and an app-level user model that supports two roles: Candidate and Employer. Provide a role selection/confirmation step on first sign-in and persist the chosen role for subsequent sessions.

Build public (unauthenticated) pages that mirror a job marketplace like Wrokindia.in, branded as “Instant Jobs”: a landing/home page, a job search/browse page, and a job detail page. The landing page should clearly present the two user journeys (Find Jobs / Hire Candidates) and route users appropriately.
Build Candidate features and UI: Candidate dashboard showing applied jobs, ability to apply to a job via an application form, and view application status history/current status.
Build Employer features and UI: Employer dashboard with job posting form, manage posted jobs, view applicants per job, and update applicant/application status.
Apply “Instant Jobs” branding across the entire product (name, logo, headings, metadata). Do not use “Workindia” in any user-visible content.

Establish a coherent visual theme for the clone (colors, typography, spacing, components) suitable for a modern job marketplace, and apply it consistently across pages using Tailwind + the existing UI component library.
Add generated static image assets to the frontend and render them in the UI (store under frontend/public/assets/generated). Use these assets for the product logo and landing page hero illustration.
Add a user-facing authentication UX that clearly communicates the app uses Internet Identity for login/signup (not Google OAuth), and update login-related UI copy accordingly.

Add a dedicated, easy-to-find help section (e.g., on the landing page or a small modal linked near the Login button) explaining what Internet Identity is and how to use it to create an account and sign in.

Identify which backend canister functions are reported as “missing” after the latest deployment by reproducing the issue in the running app and capturing the exact console/runtime errors (e.g., "actor.<method> is not a function" or Candid method-not-found).

Restore full parity between the frontend’s expected actor API and the backend canister’s exported Candid interface by ensuring all functions used in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts exist and are callable on the deployed canister (including chooseRole, getCallerUserProfile, saveCallerUserProfile, getJobs, getJob, getJobsByEmployer, createJob, deleteJob, applyForJob, getApplicationsForCandidate, getApplicationsForJob, updateApplicationStatus).

Add user-facing error handling for actor call failures related to missing/unsupported methods so the UI shows a clear English message (and does not silently fail) when a backend method is unavailable, including on Job detail apply, Employer job creation, and application status update actions.

new_feature_requests.summary: Rename branding from Workindia to Instant Jobs across the cloned product.

Create the core data models and backend APIs for a job marketplace: Job (created by Employer), JobApplication (created by Candidate for a Job), and UserProfile (per principal, with role-specific fields). Include CRUD for Employer jobs, job browsing/searching for Candidates, and application submission + status updates.
Add real Google Authentication for login & signup (Google OAuth sign-in).
